Title: Vice President of Technology
Headline: Stephen Faris was Appointed as Vice President of Technology at digiChart
What Happened: Brentwood; TX-based digiChart appointed Stephen Faris as Vice President of Technology.
About Person: Stephen Faris previously served as Chief Technology Officer for Healthgate Data Corporation and has extensive experience consulting with companies on their technology and applications strategies.
About Company: digiChart Announces New Executives and New Offices July 15; 2010 BRENTWOOD; Tenn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--digiChart; Inc. today announced the appointment of two new members to its executive team; Bob Allen and Stephen Faris. The company also announced the relocation of its headquarters to Brentwood; TN; a nearby suburb of Nashville; TN. Bob Allen joins digiChart as National Director of Sales. Mr. Allen will be responsible for all the sales and marketing efforts of the company. Most recently; he served as Vice President of Sales in McKessons Physician Practice Solutions business. He brings over 20 years experience in sales and healthcare technology. Stephen Faris will serve as Vice President of Technology; leading digiCharts product development and technical operations. He previously served as Chief Technology Officer for Healthgate Data Corporation and has extensive experience consulting with companies on their technology and applications strategies. We are excited two exceptional leaders such as Bob and Stephen join our executive team; said digiChart CEO Bill Bates. We are growing and moving forward with exciting initiatives to fully connect OB-GYN care. Bob and Stephens experience will serve us well. They will be central to our success. digiChart also announced the relocation of its headquarters to Brentwood; TN; a nearby suburb of Nashville; TN. The move positions the leader in OB-GYN electronic medical records and practice management systems software for its growth plans and will enable improved service and support for its customers throughout the United States. The Nashville area is a hub for the healthcare; said COO Shelley Predmore. We have enjoyed a rewarding history of growth and success from being in the center of the industrys activities and will continue to do so. Our new offices offer us a state-of-the-art training center for our clients and better consolidate our overall operations. The space will serve us for years to come as we serve our customers. The companys new address is: digiChart; Inc. 100 Winner's Circle; Suite 450 Brentwood; TN 37027  About digiChart; Inc. (www.digichart.com) Based in Brentwood; TN; digiChart; Inc. is a leader in healthcare information technology solutions and services. Dedicated to improving women's healthcare; digiChart provides electronic health record (EHR) and practice management system (PMS) solutions; along with the related training; implementation and workflow improvement services. OB-GYN practices across the country use digiChart's solutions to streamline and optimize their practices clinically and inancially; as well as achieve higher rates of patient satisfaction. Every day; over 100;000 active pregnancies and nearly 1;800;000 womens records are managed through digiCharts solutions. digiChart is a MedCare company. MedCare is a althcare-focused fund invested in a portfolio of healthcare services; healthcare IT and medical device companies with combined revenues of over $350M. Contacts digiChart; Inc. Shelley Predmore; Chief Operating Officer; 615-312-1630 ore@digichart.com

Title: Chief Technology Officer
Headline: Sandy Burns was Promoted to Chief Technology Officer at Heart Force Medical
What Happened: Vancouver; BC-based Heart Force Medical promoted Sandy Burns to Chief Technology Officer.
About Person: Sandy Burns was previously Director Of Technology and Engineering at HeartForce Medical Inc
About Company: Heart Force Medical Inc. (HFM); a private company; has invented and has patents pending for the digital Ballistocardiograph (dBG(TM)). The dBG 300; which is already approved in Canada and the United States; captures the movement of the heart during each cardiac cycle (heart beat). This movement (acceleration and force) is sensed by an accelerometer aligned to the three principal axes and displayed on a computer screen using HFM's proprietary software. Preliminary evaluation has determined that a 10-30 second recording of the dBG waveform is sufficient for a detailed analysis of cardiac performance. The Heart Force dBG 300 device is a non-invasive; standalone; portable unit and contains sophisticated digital sensors and proprietary software.
